001package net.tvburger.jdl.model.nn.optimizers;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Strategy;
004import net.tvburger.jdl.model.DataSet;
005import net.tvburger.jdl.model.nn.ActivationsCachedNeuron;
006import net.tvburger.jdl.model.nn.NeuralNetwork;
007import net.tvburger.jdl.model.nn.Neuron;
008import net.tvburger.jdl.model.nn.NeuronVisitor;
009import net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.ObjectiveFunction;
010import net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.Optimizer;
011
012import java.util.IdentityHashMap;
013import java.util.Map;
014
015/**
016 * Stochastic Gradient Descent (SGD) optimizer with per-sample backpropagation and
017 * batch accumulation of gradients.
018 * <p>
019 * This implementation:
020 * <ul>
021 *   <li>Performs a forward pass for each sample, computes error signals (δ), and
022 *       accumulates weight/bias gradients over the given {@link DataSet}.</li>
023 *   <li>Applies a single parameter update after processing the full set (i.e., a mini-batch/batch step).</li>
024 *   <li>Relies on {@link ActivationsCachedNeuron} to access cached forward-pass values needed for backprop.</li>
025 *   <li>Deactivates neuron activation caches after parameters are updated.</li>
026 * </ul>
027 *
028 * <p><strong>Batch scaling convention:</strong> This class, as written, assumes the provided
029 * {@link ObjectiveFunction#calculateGradient_dJ_da(int, float[], float[])} returns
030 * gradients already scaled by the batch size (i.e., mean over the batch). Consequently,
031 * parameter updates do not divide by the batch size again on apply.</p>
032 *
033 * @param <N> a {@link NeuralNetwork} type optimized by this optimizer
034 */
035@Strategy(Strategy.Role.CONCRETE)
036public class StochasticGradientDescent<N extends NeuralNetwork> implements Optimizer<N> {
037
038    /**
039     * Default learning rate used when none is set explicitly.
040     */
041    public static final float DEFAULT_LEARNING_RATE = 0.1f;
042
043    private float learningRate = DEFAULT_LEARNING_RATE;
044
045    /**
046     * Sets the learning rate (step size) used for parameter updates.
047     *
048     * @param learningRate the learning rate &eta; (must be &gt; 0)
049     */
050    public void setLearningRate(float learningRate) {
051        this.learningRate = learningRate;
052    }
053
054    /**
055     * Returns the current learning rate.
056     *
057     * @return the learning rate &eta;
058     */
059    public float getLearningRate() {
060        return learningRate;
061    }
062
063    /**
064     * Runs one optimization step over the provided training set.
065     * <p>
066     * For each sample, this method:
067     * <ol>
068     *   <li>Performs a forward pass to get network outputs.</li>
069     *   <li>Computes the loss gradient w.r.t. activations from the {@link ObjectiveFunction}.</li>
070     *   <li>Backpropagates error signals (δ) layer-by-layer to accumulate gradients for all weights and biases.</li>
071     * </ol>
072     * After all samples are processed, it applies the accumulated gradients to the network parameters
073     * using the configured learning rate, and deactivates activation caches.
074     *
075     * <p><strong>Note:</strong> This implementation assumes {@code objective.calculateGradient_dJ_da}
076     * returns gradients that are already averaged over the batch size passed in. Therefore the
077     * final parameter updates do not perform an additional division by the batch size.</p>
078     *
079     * @param neuralNetwork the network to optimize
080     * @param trainingSet   the data used for one optimization step (treated here as a batch)
081     * @param objective     the objective/loss function providing gradients w.r.t. output activations
082     */
083    @Override
084    public void optimize(N neuralNetwork, DataSet trainingSet, ObjectiveFunction objective) {
085        int batchSize = trainingSet.samples().size();
086        if (batchSize == 0) {
087            return;
088        }
089
090        // Allocate accumulators for gradients (sum over batch)
091        final Map<Neuron, float[]> weightedVotesForWeightCorrections = new IdentityHashMap<>();
092        final Map<Neuron, Float> weightedVotesForBiasCorrections = new IdentityHashMap<>();
093
094        // For each sample n, compute error signal δ - delta - layer-by-layer (backward), accumulate gradients
095        trainingSet.samples().forEach(s -> voteForParameterCorrections(s, batchSize, weightedVotesForWeightCorrections, weightedVotesForBiasCorrections, neuralNetwork, objective));
096
097        // Apply changes
098        neuralNetwork.accept(new NeuronVisitor() {
099            @Override
100            public void visitNeuron(NeuralNetwork neuralNetwork, Neuron neuron, int layerIndex, int neuronIndex) {
101                float[] gw = weightedVotesForWeightCorrections.get(neuron);
102                if (gw != null) {
103                    for (int d = 1; d <= neuron.arity(); d++) {
104                        neuron.adjustWeight(d, -learningRate * gw[d - 1]);
105                    }
106                }
107                Float gb = weightedVotesForBiasCorrections.get(neuron);
108                if (gb != null) {
109                    neuron.adjustBias(-learningRate * gb);
110                }
111                if (neuron instanceof ActivationsCachedNeuron a) {
112                    a.deactivate();
113                }
114            }
115        });
116    }
117
118    private void voteForParameterCorrections(DataSet.Sample sample, int batchSize, Map<Neuron, float[]> weightedVotesForWeightCorrections, Map<Neuron, Float> weightedVotesForBiasCorrections, N neuralNetwork, ObjectiveFunction objective) {
119        Map<Neuron, Float> errorSignals = new IdentityHashMap<>();
120        float[] estimated = neuralNetwork.estimate(sample.features());
121        float[] lossGradients = objective.calculateGradient_dJ_da(1, estimated, sample.targetOutputs());
122        for (int j = 0; j < neuralNetwork.coArity(); j++) {
123            voteForOutputNodeParameterCorrections(batchSize, weightedVotesForWeightCorrections, weightedVotesForBiasCorrections, neuralNetwork, lossGradients, errorSignals, j);
124        }
125        for (int l = neuralNetwork.getDepth() - 1; l >= 1; l--) {
126            int width = neuralNetwork.getWidth(l);
127            for (int j = 0; j < width; j++) {
128                voteForHiddenNodeParameterCorrections(batchSize, weightedVotesForWeightCorrections, weightedVotesForBiasCorrections, neuralNetwork, errorSignals, l, j);
129            }
130        }
131    }
132
133    private void voteForOutputNodeParameterCorrections(int batchSize, Map<Neuron, float[]> weightedVotesForWeightCorrections, Map<Neuron, Float> weightedVotesForBiasCorrections, N neuralNetwork, float[] lossGradients, Map<Neuron, Float> errorSignals, int j) {
134        ActivationsCachedNeuron outputNode = neuralNetwork.getNeuron(neuralNetwork.getDepth(), j, ActivationsCachedNeuron.class);
135        ActivationsCachedNeuron.Activation activation = outputNode.getCache().getLast();
136
137        // determine error signal for output node
138        float errorSignal = lossGradients[j] * outputNode.getActivationFunction().determineGradientForOutput(activation.output());
139        errorSignals.put(outputNode, errorSignal); // track error signal for upstream nodes
140
141        // determine bias gradient
142        voteForNodeParameterCorrections(batchSize, weightedVotesForWeightCorrections, weightedVotesForBiasCorrections, errorSignal, outputNode, activation);
143    }
144
145    private void voteForHiddenNodeParameterCorrections(int batchSize, Map<Neuron, float[]> weightedVotesForWeightCorrections, Map<Neuron, Float> weightedVotesForBiasCorrections, N neuralNetwork, Map<Neuron, Float> errorSignals, int l, int j) {
146        ActivationsCachedNeuron hiddenNode = neuralNetwork.getNeuron(l, j, ActivationsCachedNeuron.class);
147        ActivationsCachedNeuron.Activation activation = hiddenNode.getCache().getLast();
148
149        // determine error signal for hidden node using back propagation
150        float backPropagation = 0.0f;
151        Map<Neuron, Float> outs = neuralNetwork.getOutputConnections(l, j);
152        for (Map.Entry<Neuron, Float> e : outs.entrySet()) {
153            float connectionWeight = e.getValue();
154            float errorSignalDownstream = errorSignals.getOrDefault(e.getKey(), 0.0f);
155            backPropagation += errorSignalDownstream * connectionWeight;
156        }
157        float errorSignal = backPropagation * hiddenNode.getActivationFunction().determineGradientForOutput(activation.output());
158        errorSignals.put(hiddenNode, errorSignal);
159
160        voteForNodeParameterCorrections(batchSize, weightedVotesForWeightCorrections, weightedVotesForBiasCorrections, errorSignal, hiddenNode, activation);
161    }
162
163    private void voteForNodeParameterCorrections(int batchSize, Map<Neuron, float[]> weightedVotesForWeightCorrections, Map<Neuron, Float> weightedVotesForBiasCorrections, float errorSignal, ActivationsCachedNeuron hiddenNode, ActivationsCachedNeuron.Activation activation) {
164        float[] parameterGradients_df_dp = activation.parameterGradients_df_dp();
165
166        // determine bias gradient
167        float biasGradient = errorSignal * parameterGradients_df_dp[0];
168        float weightedVoteForBiasCorrection = biasGradient / batchSize;
169        weightedVotesForBiasCorrections.merge(hiddenNode, weightedVoteForBiasCorrection, Float::sum); // add all up for all samples
170
171        // determine weight gradients
172        float[] inputs = activation.inputs();
173        float[] gradientSumPerWeight = weightedVotesForWeightCorrections.computeIfAbsent(hiddenNode, k -> new float[inputs.length]);
174        for (int d = 1; d <= inputs.length; d++) {
175            float weightGradient = errorSignal * parameterGradients_df_dp[d];
176            float weightedVoteForWeightCorrection = weightGradient / batchSize;
177            gradientSumPerWeight[d - 1] += weightedVoteForWeightCorrection; // add the weight correction (over all samples)
178        }
179    }
180}
